subroutine sort(arr)

implicit none

integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

integer :: i, j, temp, n

n = size(arr)

do i=1, n-1

    do j=i+1, n

        if (arr(i) > arr(j)) then

            temp = arr(i)

            arr(i) = arr(j)

            arr(j) = temp

        end if

    end do

end do

end subroutine sort

This is a simple bubble sort, which is O(n²), but for the problem's constraints (n up to maybe 1e5?), but the original Java code uses ArrayList and Collections.sort which is O(n log n).

program main

implicit none

integer :: n, ans, status

integer, allocatable :: a(:), temp(:)

! Read first part's input

read(*,*) n

if (n ==1) then

    read(*,*) ans

else

    allocate(a(n))

    read(*,*) a

    call sort(a) ! Need a sorting routine

    if (a(n) ==0) then

        ans =0

    else

            call func(a, temp, status)

            if (status ==1) then

                ans =1

                exit

            end if

            a = temp

        end do

        if (status /=1) then

            ans = a(1)

        end if

    end if

end if

implicit none

integer :: n, ans, status, i, n_s, m = 1000000007

integer, allocatable :: a(:), temp(:), dp(:,:), new_a(:)

    call sort(a)

    if (a(n) ==0) then

        ans =0

    else

        do while (size(a) >1)

            call func(a, temp, status)

            if (status ==1) then

                ans =1

                exit

            end if

            a = temp

        end do

        if (status /=1) then

            ans = a(1)

        end if

    if (c == '0') then

        dp(i+1,1) = dp(i,1)

    else

    end if

    dp(i+1,1) = mod(dp(i+1,1), m)

subroutine sort(arr)

implicit none

integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

integer :: i, j, temp, n

n = size(arr)

do i=1, n-1

    do j=i+1, n

        if (arr(i) > arr(j)) then

            temp = arr(i)

            arr(i) = arr(j)

            arr(j) = temp

        end if

    end do

end do

end subroutine sort

subroutine func(a, new_a, status)

implicit none

integer, intent(in) :: a(:)

integer, allocatable, intent(out) :: new_a(:)

integer, intent(out) :: status

integer :: temp1(size(a)), temp2(size(a)), min_val, count_nonzero, k, i

! Step 1: Remove zeros from a to get temp1.

count_nonzero =0

do i=1, size(a)

    if (a(i) /=0) then

        count_nonzero = count_nonzero +1

        temp1(count_nonzero) = a(i)

    end if

end do

if (count_nonzero ==0) then

    status =0

    allocate(new_a(0))

    return

end if

min_val = temp1(1)

status =0

! Step 2: process each element.

allocate(temp2(count_nonzero))

temp2(1) = temp1(1)

do i=2, count_nonzero

    integer :: mod_val = mod(temp1(i), min_val)

    temp2(i) = mod_val

    if (mod_val ==1) then

        status =1

        exit

    end if

end do

if (status ==1) then

    deallocate(temp2)

    allocate(new_a(0))

    return

end if

! Now, remove zeros from temp2.

count_nonzero =0

do i=1, size(temp2)

    if (temp2(i) /=0) then

        count_nonzero = count_nonzero +1

    end if

end do

allocate(new_a(count_nonzero))

k=1

do i=1, size(temp2)

    if (temp2(i) /=0) then

        new_a(k) = temp2(i)

        k =k+1

    end if

end do

! Sort new_a.

call sort(new_a)

deallocate(temp2)

end subroutine func

end program main
